[[File:Miriam Ellis - What Hal saw beyond the North Moors.jpg|thumb|250px|right|"What [[Halfast Gamgee|Hal]] saw beyond the North Moors" by [[Miriam Ellis]]]]
The '''North Moors''' lay along the northern border of the [[Shire]] in the [[Northfarthing]].<ref name="FRHobbits">{{FR|Hobbits}}</ref>

==Geography==
The North Moors was located roughly fifty leagues (150 miles) north of the [[Marshes in the south]].<ref name="FRHobbits">{{FR|Hobbits}}</ref> No elm trees grew in the North Moors,<ref name="Tree">{{FR|I2}}</ref> and it was the one region within the bounds of the Shire where heavy snowfalls were common.<ref>{{FR|II3}}</ref>

==History==
Around the spring of {{TA|3018}}, [[Samwise Gamgee]] heard a rumor that his cousin, [[Halfast Gamgee]], reported seeing [[Tree-men]] or [[giants]] away beyond the North Moors.<ref name="Tree">{{FR|I2}}</ref>

==Inspiration==
Assuming that Halfast's story is not a fanciful fabrication and he did see something strange, [[fandom|fans]] have connected the "tree-man" to the [[Ents]] (or [[Entwives]]) that appear later in the story. However [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] specifically mentioned that he had not invented the Ents before the moment he reached the chapter ''[[Treebeard (chapter)|Treebeard]]''<ref>{{L|231}}</ref> and the "tree-man" reference was written before it.<ref>{{HM|RS}}, pp. 253-254</ref> It was unknown whether Tolkien himself consciously considered such a connection, revisited the matter subsequently,<ref>{{webcite|author=WDBL, Paul Adams, Mark Gordon|articleurl=http://tolkien.slimy.com/tfaq/EnemyMisc.html#Entwives|articlename=What became of the Entwives?|dated=|website=[[Tolkien FAQ]]|accessed=}}</ref> or decided that Halfast should not be taken at his word. However, Tolkien once stated in a letter to James Heaf on [[28 February]] in [[1964]] that he did "not think it was an [[Entwives|Entwife]] which Hal saw on the North Moors" and suggested the possibility that the Tree-man may have been "a [[Trolls|troll]]" of some kind.<ref name="unpublished">[https://www.tolkienguide.com/guide/letters/544?q=tag%3AEntwives TCG Letter #544] on the Tolkien Collector Guide</ref> While trolls were never said to be capable of "walking seven yards to a stride", it is possible that some details of the sighting may have been exaggerated by Halfast.
